column1: Purposes of Processing
We may process your Personal Data for the purposes of:
providing the Services to our customers;
creating and updating data sets;
providing targeted advertising and content;
responding to your requests or questions; and
sending you email marketing communications about our business which we think may interest you.
Data Retention

For Personal Data , We keep your Personal Data only for as long as we need it for our legitimate business purposes. For example, when we collect information about your interaction with an advertisement served to you, we retain that information for the calendar quarter and then delete it. Other information, like device ids, we retain for our ongoing Services. We will retain your information for as long as the Services are active and after that, for a period which enables us to handle or respond to any complaints, queries or concerns relating to the Services. We will periodically review the Personal Data we hold and delete it securely, or in some cases anonymize it, when there is no longer a legal, business, or consumer need for it to be retained.
Sharing Personal Data with Third Parties

As discussed more fully in our Privacy Policies, most of the information we collect and use is de-identified and aggregated information, such as de-identified categories of app use and jittered geolocation information associated with a de-identified device id. We also provide partners with de-identified mobile device activity in aggregate, except in cases when the actual device id is needed, such as for targeted advertising, and for matching and measurement of advertising. De-identified and aggregated information is not Personal Data, and we use such information in a number of ways for our business intelligence services as we discuss in our Privacy Policy. We may also share aggregate, anonymized information with advertisers, clients, customers, and partners when providing our Services to those parties.

We may also share Personal Data with third party service providers, who process Personal Data on our behalf, and who agree to use the Personal Data only to assist us in providing our Services or as required by law. Our service providers may provide:
payment processing services;
cloud storage services;
web site hosting services;
maintenance and IT services;
customer support services;
analytics and metrics services;
email software; and
CRM software.

Some of these third parties may be located outside of the United States. However, before transferring your Personal Data to these third parties, we will either ask for your explicit consent or require the third party to maintain at least the same level of privacy and security for your Personal Data that we do.
We do not share or use your Twitter handle other than to authenticate your use on our Twitter-based Apps.
Cookies

A “cookie” is a small file stored on your device that contains information about your device. We may use cookies to provide basic relevant ads, website functionality, authentication (session management), usage analytics (web analytics), and to remember your settings, and generally improve our applications, websites, and Services.

If you would prefer not to accept cookies, you can change the setup of your browser to reject all or some cookies. Note, if you reject certain cookies, you may not be able to use all of our Services’ features. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutcookies.org/.

You may also set your browser to send a Do Not Track (DNT) signal. For more information, please visit https://allaboutdnt.com/. Please note that our Services do not have the capability to respond to “Do Not Track” signals received from web browsers.
Access & Review
If we process your Personal Data, you may have the right to request access to (or to update, correct, or delete) such Personal Data.

You may also have the right to opt out of having your Personal Data shared with third parties and to revoke your consent to our sharing your Personal Data with third parties. You may also have the right to opt out if your Personal Data is used for any purpose that is materially different from the purpose(s) for which it was originally collected or which you originally authorized. To submit these requests or raise any other questions, please visit our Consumer Choices and Opt Out Options page.
Exercising Access, Data Portability, And Deletion Rights

You have the right to request that we disclose certain information to you about our collection and use of your Personal Data. To provide this information we need your mobile advertising device id (which is a unique id number assigned to each device). We ask you to complete a form and then follow the instructions to provide us with a legible image of your mobile advertising device id. To exercise the rights described above, please visit our Consumer Choices pages. We cannot respond to your request or provide you with Personal Data if we cannot verify your mobile device identity to confirm the Personal Data relates to you. Making a verifiable consumer request does not require you to create an account with us. We will only use Personal Data provided in a verifiable consumer request to verify the requestor’s identity or authority to make the request.

We provide you with reasonable access and deletion rights to the Personal Data. If you live in the EU, and wish to exercise your rights with respect to any Personal Data we hold about you, please visit our “Consumer Choices” pages.

We endeavor to respond to a verifiable consumer request promptly. If we require more time (than required by law), we will inform you of the reason and extension period in writing. We do not charge a fee to process or respond to your verifiable consumer request unless it is excessive, repetitive, or unfounded.
Changes To This Notice
We reserve the right to amend this notice at our discretion and at any time. When we make changes to this privacy notice, we will post the updated information on our website.
Contact Information

If you have any questions or comments about this notice, our Privacy Statement, the ways in which we collect and use your Personal Data, your choices and rights regarding such use, or wish to exercise your rights under GDPR, please do not hesitate to contact us.
Consumer Choices and Opt Out Options
Effective: 13 October 2021

Thank you for your interest regarding what personal information for data subjects in the: (i) European Union, UK or Switzerland pursuant to the European Directives 95/46/EC and 2002/58/EC (EU General Data Protection Regulations Legislation, also known as “GDPR”); (ii) California; and (iii) rest of the world is processed at Near. Pte. Ltd. Here is information about how you can control, delete or opt out of further sales with respect to this information.
Communication from Us

You can tell us to stop sending you marketing emails by clicking the unsubscribe link included at the bottom of the marketing emails. If you have provided us with contact information for a business relationship (sales) or customer support, you can ask us to delete this information using the email privacy@near.com. In some cases, We need to send you “transactional” emails relating to normal business operations. For example, we may email you to inform you about certain account activity. You cannot opt out of these emails.
Your Use of our Apps

When you utilize our mobile apps (“Apps”), we collect your twitter handle and information about how you use those Apps and/or respond to advertisements on those Apps. Tell us if you would like us to stop collecting information about how you use our Apps. Please note that you will have to repeat this process for each App and account.
Learn More >
Services

The categories of personal information collected by Near’s business services are mobile advertising device ids (MAID), IP addresses, advertising click stream information and location data associated with that device as discussed more fully in our Business Services Privacy Policy. Among other things, we do not collect an actual cell phone numbers or your name, full address or email address.
A sample of what personal information for a device is as follows:
Mobile advertising device id
IP Addresses and general (city or postal code) location data that can be extrapolated from an IP address
Latitude and longitude points
Timestamps with local dates and times and time zones
DO NOT SELL MY PERSONAL INFORMATION

CCPA ensures that Users are provided with the right to opt-out from their personal data being sold. If you would like to opt out of all sales of any personal information we may have associated with your device, please click here to complete a form to OPT OUT OF SALES. The information you supply to us for this request will only be used for the purpose of identifying the personal information about the device which you are requesting and responding to your request (including a record of our efforts).
DELETION REQUEST

If you would like us to DELETE the personal information we have associated with your device, please click here to complete a form to request DATA DELETION. The information you supply to us for this request will only be used for the purpose of identifying the Personal Information about the device which you are requesting and responding to your request (including a record of our efforts).
ACCESS

Certain jurisdictions also provide consumers with rights to request access (correction or portability) of the personal information held about them. We are not able to provide you with the particular file about any particular device because we are not able to confirm who the actual device owner is. We need your manufacturers’ advertising device id (the IDFAs for iOS, and Android Ad IDs for Android, “MAIDs”) in order to identify the device in our systems but we don’t have a way to confirm that the device MAID belongs to any particular person. We do not retain information that would match the device id to the actual owner, so we do not have a way to confirm that the consumer requesting the information is the same consumer that owns the device. It would require us to actually collect more personal information to try to verify who the device owner is, such as requesting their full name, address, and receipt of purchase of the device. Additionally we want to avoid the potential risk of providing a requestor who provides a MAID with the personal information that could belong to another individual. For example, the requestor takes a snapshot of the device id of his fiancée to request her personal information without her consent. If you are uncomfortable with our having any personal information about you, please complete the form to request a DATA DELETION.
Our Apps

For our Apps Echofon, UberSocial, and Plume, you log into the account using your Twitter credentials. We retain your Twitter handle as your account name but do not have access to your password. Twitter does. You can ask us at any time to delete your account on our Apps. Form here.

Please note that all of your Twitter post, timeline, profile and other information reside with Twitter and are not held by us. Please contact Twitter to exercise consumer choices with the information they hold. Please also note even if we delete your account upon your request, but you continue to use Twitter with your account information, that information is stored by Twitter and would be accessible again, if you decide to re-engage with our apps.",Others
ra3,This policy was last updated on 22 September 2022,Updated Privacy Policy

ra3,"Our websites and apps use cookies and other similar tracking technologies.

A cookie is a small file of letters and numbers that we store on your browser or in your device's storage.

We also use web beacons (code included in web pages, emails and advertisements) that give us information about when those emails, pages and advertisements have been viewed or clicked.

In this policy we refer to all types of tracking technologies as ""cookies"".",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra3,"Essential Cookies
We use essential cookies to distinguish you from other users of our websites and apps. This helps us to provide you with a good experience when you use our websites and apps. We are permitted to place these cookies without your prior consent, but you can block all cookies, including essential cookies by changing your browser settings. Please note if you block all cookies, you might not be able to see or access all parts of our websites and apps.

Non-Essential Cookies
The other types of cookies we use are non-essential cookies. We use these to help us making improvements to our products and services.",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra3,"Preference cookies enable a website to remember information that changes the way the website behaves or looks, like your preferred language or the region that you are in.

Name	Provider	Purpose	Expiry	Type
player	Vimeo	Saves the user's preferences when playing embedded videos from Vimeo.	1 year	HTTP Cookie

",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra3,"Statistic cookies help website owners to understand how visitors interact with websites by collecting and reporting information anonymously.

Name	Provider	Purpose	Expiry	Type
__hssc	js.hs-banner.com	Identifies if the cookie data needs to be updated in the visitor's browser.	1 day	HTTP Cookie
__hssrc	js.hs-banner.com	Used to recognise the visitor's browser upon reentry on the website.	Session	HTTP Cookie
__hstc	js.hs-banner.com	Sets a unique ID for the session. This allows the website to obtain data on visitor behaviour for statistical purposes.	179 days	HTTP Cookie
ajs_anonymous_id	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	This cookie is used to identify a specific visitor - this information is used to identify the number of specific visitors on a website.	1 year	HTTP Cookie
ajs_anonymous_id	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	This cookie is used to count how many times a website has been visited by different visitors - this is done by assigning the visitor an ID, so the visitor does not get registered twice.	Persistent	HTML Local Storage
aka_debug	Akamai Technologies	Used by Vimeo to track usage of their embedded video player	Session	HTTP Cookie
AnalyticsSyncHistory	LinkedIn	Used in connection with data-synchronization with third-party analysis service.	29 days	HTTP Cookie
vuid	Vimeo	Collects data on the user's visits to the website, such as which pages have been read.	399 days	HTTP Cookie
ziwsSessionId	ws.zoominfo.com	Collects statistics on the user's visits to the website, such as the number of visits, average time spent on the website and what pages have been read.	Session	HTML Local Storage
",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra3,"Marketing cookies are used to track visitors across websites. The intention is to display ads that are relevant and engaging for the individual user and thereby more valuable for publishers and third party advertisers.

Name	Provider	Purpose	Expiry	Type
__ptq.gif	Hubspot	Sends data to the marketing platform Hubspot about the visitor's device and behaviour. Tracks the visitor across devices and marketing channels.	Session	Pixel Tracker
__tld__	near.com	Used to track visitors on multiple websites, in order to present relevant advertisement based on the visitor's preferences.	Session	HTTP Cookie
_gcl_au	Google	Used by Google AdSense for experimenting with advertisement efficiency across websites using their services.	3 months	HTTP Cookie
_rm_dr	assets.rampmetrics.com	Pending	1 day	HTTP Cookie
ajs%3Acookies	near.com	Collects data on visitors. This information is used to assign visitors into segments, making website advertisement more efficient.	1 year	HTTP Cookie
ajs%3Atest	near.com	Collects data on visitors. This information is used to assign visitors into segments, making website advertisement more efficient.	1 year	HTTP Cookie
ajs_group_id	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	This cookie is used to assign specific visitors into segments, this segmentation is based on visitor behavior on the website - the segmentation can be used to target larger groups.	1 year	HTTP Cookie
ajs_group_id	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	Collects data on visitors. This information is used to assign visitors into segments, making website advertisement more efficient.	Persistent	HTML Local Storage
ajs_group_properties	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	Collects data on visitors. This information is used to assign visitors into segments, making website advertisement more efficient.	Persistent	HTML Local Storage
ajs_user_id	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	Collects data on visitors' preferences and behaviour on the website - This information is used make content and advertisement more relevant to the specific visitor.	Persistent	HTML Local Storage
ajs_user_id	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	This cookie is used to collect data on the visitor's behavior on the website - this information can be used to assign the visitor to a visitor segment, based on common preferences.	1 year	HTTP Cookie
ajs_user_traits	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	Collects data on visitors. This information is used to assign visitors into segments, making website advertisement more efficient.	Persistent	HTML Local Storage
bcookie	LinkedIn	Used by the social networking service, LinkedIn, for tracking the use of embedded services.	1 year	HTTP Cookie
bscookie	LinkedIn	Used by the social networking service, LinkedIn, for tracking the use of embedded services.	1 year	HTTP Cookie
collect	LinkedIn	Collects data on user behaviour and interaction in order to optimize the website and make advertisement on the website more relevant.	Session	Pixel Tracker
hubspotutk	js.hs-banner.com	Sets a unique ID for the session. This allows the website to obtain data on visitor behaviour for statistical purposes.	179 days	HTTP Cookie
IDE	Google	Used by Google DoubleClick to register and report the website user's actions after viewing or clicking one of the advertiser's ads with the purpose of measuring the efficacy of an ad and to present targeted ads to the user.	1 year	HTTP Cookie
li_gc	LinkedIn	Stores the user's cookie consent state for the current domain	179 days	HTTP Cookie
lidc	LinkedIn	Used by the social networking service, LinkedIn, for tracking the use of embedded services.	1 day	HTTP Cookie
pagead/1p-user-list/#	Google	Tracks if the user has shown interest in specific products or events across multiple websites and detects how the user navigates between sites. This is used for measurement of advertisement efforts and facilitates payment of referral-fees between websites.	Session	Pixel Tracker
pagead/landing [x2]	Google	Collects data on visitor behaviour from multiple websites, in order to present more relevant advertisement - This also allows the website to limit the number of times that they are shown the same advertisement.	Session	Pixel Tracker
test_cookie	Google	Used to check if the user's browser supports cookies.	1 day	HTTP Cookie
UserMatchHistory	LinkedIn	Used to track visitors on multiple websites, in order to present relevant advertisement based on the visitor's preferences.	29 days	HTTP Cookie
",Categories of Personal Information Collected

column1: ra3,"Preference cookies enable a website to remember information that changes the way the website behaves or looks, like your preferred language or the region that you are in.

column1: ra3,"Statistic cookies help website owners to understand how visitors interact with websites by collecting and reporting information anonymously.
Name	Provider	Purpose	Expiry	Type
aka_debug	Akamai Technologies	Used by Vimeo to track usage of their embedded video player	Session	HTTP
AnalyticsSyncHistory	LinkedIn	Used in connection with data-synchronization with third-party analysis service.	29 days	HTTP
__hssc	js.hs-banner.com	Identifies if the cookie data needs to be updated in the visitor's browser.	1 day	HTTP
__hssrc	js.hs-banner.com	Used to recognise the visitor's browser upon reentry on the website.	Session	HTTP
__hstc	js.hs-banner.com	Sets a unique ID for the session. This allows the website to obtain data on visitor behaviour for statistical purposes.	179 days	HTTP
ajs_anonymous_id	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	This cookie is used to identify a specific visitor - this information is used to identify the number of specific visitors on a website.	1 year	HTTP

ajs_anonymous_id	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	This cookie is used to count how many times a website has been visited by different visitors - this is done by assigning the visitor an ID, so the visitor does not get registered twice.	Persistent	HTML
ziwsSessionId	ws.zoominfo.com	Collects statistics on the user's visits to the website, such as the number of visits, average time spent on the website and what pages have been read.	Session	HTML
vuid	Vimeo	Collects data on the user's visits to the website, such as which pages have been read.	399 days	HTTP",Categories of Personal Information Collected

column1: ra3,"Marketing cookies are used to track visitors across websites. The intention is to display ads that are relevant and engaging for the individual user and thereby more valuable for publishers and third party advertisers.
Name	Provider	Purpose	Expiry	Type
collect	LinkedIn	Collects data on user behaviour and interaction in order to optimize the website and make advertisement on the website more relevant.	Session	Pixel

IDE	Google	Used by Google DoubleClick to register and report the website user's actions after viewing or clicking one of the advertiser's ads with the purpose of measuring the efficacy of an ad and to present targeted ads to the user.	1 year	HTTP

pagead/landing [x2]	Google	Collects data on visitor behaviour from multiple websites, in order to present more relevant advertisement - This also allows the website to limit the number of times that they are shown the same advertisement.	Session	Pixel
test_cookie	Google	Used to check if the user's browser supports cookies.	1 day	HTTP

pagead/1p-user-list/#	Google	Tracks if the user has shown interest in specific products or events across multiple websites and detects how the user navigates between sites. This is used for measurement of advertisement efforts and facilitates payment of referral-fees between websites.	Session	Pixel
__ptq.gif	Hubspot	Sends data to the marketing platform Hubspot about the visitor's device and behaviour. Tracks the visitor across devices and marketing channels.	Session	Pixel
bcookie	LinkedIn	Used by the social networking service, LinkedIn, for tracking the use of embedded services.	1 year	HTTP
bscookie	LinkedIn	Used by the social networking service, LinkedIn, for tracking the use of embedded services.	1 year	HTTP
li_gc	LinkedIn	Stores the user's cookie consent state for the current domain	179 days	HTTP
lidc	LinkedIn	Used by the social networking service, LinkedIn, for tracking the use of embedded services.	1 day	HTTP
UserMatchHistory	LinkedIn	Used to track visitors on multiple websites, in order to present relevant advertisement based on the visitor's preferences.	29 days	HTTP
__tld__	near.com	Used to track visitors on multiple websites, in order to present relevant advertisement based on the visitor's preferences.	Session	HTTP
_gcl_au	Google	Used by Google AdSense for experimenting with advertisement efficiency across websites using their services.	3 months	HTTP
_rm_dr	assets.rampmetrics.com	Pending	1 day	HTTP
ajs%3Acookies	near.com	Collects data on visitors. This information is used to assign visitors into segments, making website advertisement more efficient.	1 year	HTTP
ajs%3Atest	near.com	Collects data on visitors. This information is used to assign visitors into segments, making website advertisement more efficient.	1 year	HTTP

ajs_group_id	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	This cookie is used to assign specific visitors into segments, this segmentation is based on visitor behavior on the website - the segmentation can be used to target larger groups.	1 year	HTTP
ajs_group_id	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	Collects data on visitors. This information is used to assign visitors into segments, making website advertisement more efficient.	Persistent	HTML
ajs_group_properties	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	Collects data on visitors. This information is used to assign visitors into segments, making website advertisement more efficient.	Persistent	HTML

ajs_user_id	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	Collects data on visitors' preferences and behaviour on the website - This information is used make content and advertisement more relevant to the specific visitor.	Persistent	HTML

ajs_user_id	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	This cookie is used to collect data on the visitor's behavior on the website - this information can be used to assign the visitor to a visitor segment, based on common preferences.	1 year	HTTP
ajs_user_traits	cdn.dreamdata.cloud	Collects data on visitors. This information is used to assign visitors into segments, making website advertisement more efficient.	Persistent	HTML

hubspotutk	js.hs-banner.com	Sets a unique ID for the session. This allows the website to obtain data on visitor behaviour for statistical purposes.	179 days	HTTP",Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

ra3,"Information collected through the Site
(A) Near Site
When you visit our Site or contact us to know more information about our products and services, Near collects information that identifies you or which is associated with your device or browser.
Information	Purpose
Contact Details
Name
E-mail address
Company name
Phone number
Country
To respond to your queries when you contact us.
To provide more information on our products and services when you contact us.
Send marketing emails.
Device/Browser Information
Browser type version and language;
Operating system;
Referrer URL;
Near URL’s that are accessed; and
Internet protocol (IP) address.
To determine locality of user in order to set the right language for the user.
To provide a smooth experience while accessing our Site.
We do not collect the whole IP but a part of it which is directly related to the user for better user experience.",Categories of Personal Information Collected
ra3,"Information: Contact Details Name E-mail address Company name Phone number Country
column4: Purpose: To respond to your queries when you contact us. To provide more information on our products and services when you contact us. Send marketing emails.

column1: Information: Device/Browser Information Browser type version and language; Operating system; Referrer URL; Near URL’s that are accessed; and Internet protocol (IP) address.
column4: Purpose: To determine locality of user in order to set the right language for the user. To provide a smooth experience while accessing our Site. We do not collect the whole IP but a part of it which is directly related to the user for better user experience.",Categories of Personal Information Collected

column1: ra3,"Use of information collected by Near and the legal basis for these uses
(A) Purpose
Near uses the information for the following purposes:
Responding to your inquiry;
Sending you information about Near products and services;
Sending you marketing emails; and
Investigating and responding to any comments or complaints that you may send us.",Categories of Personal Information Collected
ra3,"Sharing of personal information
(A) Sharing with Near’s Group Companies
Near will share your personal information within the Near group of companies for the purpose identified above.
If you are using an email address that is associated with a business domain (e.g., yourname@businessname.com) to access the Site, we may provide your personal information to that business.
(B) Sharing with Service Providers

Near will share your personal information with companies that help us run our business by processing personal information on behalf of Near for the purposes identified above. Such companies include Amazon Web Services and Google Analytics.
(C) Sharing with Government, Law Enforcement Agencies or Regulatory Bodies

Near will share your personal information with applicable government, legal agencies or regulatory bodies in order to comply with applicable laws and investigations or to respond to a court order, judicial or other government subpoena.
(D) Sharing with Acquiror or Merger Entity

Near may transfer information, including any personal information, to a successor entity in connection with a corporate merger, consolidation, sale of assets, bankruptcy, or other corporate change. If Near is involved in a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or a portion of its assets, you will be notified via email and/or a prominent notice on our Site of any change in ownership or uses of your personal information, as well as any choices you may have regarding your personal information.
(E) Other Information Sharing

Near may share your personal information with your consent or if it believes that it will protect Near, you or any other person or third party or to enforce any legal rights.",Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed
ra3,"Changes to this Privacy Policy
This Privacy Policy is subject to change from time to time. We encourage you to periodically review this page for the latest information on our privacy practices.",Updated Privacy Policy
ra3,01 September 2022,Updated Privacy Policy
ra3,"What information does Near collect about Users?

When individuals (“Users” or “you”) visit: (i) an App that uses the SDK of our partners; or (ii) a website that uses javascript tag of Near, Near or its partners will collect certain information about the Users which may include personal data or User’s device data. The information we collect are listed below along with the purpose for which this information is used.
Data	Purpose
1. Device information such as:
Identifiers for advertising (IDFAs) for IOS and Android ad ids for Android (together known as “MAIDs”),
IP addresses
location data,
Browser type
Device type,
Time stamp,
Operating system information and version (e.g. iOS ver 10), and
Language preference.
For providing advertising and data intelligence services.
Gender
Age
Hashed email address (HEMs)
Mobile Apps used
Impressions",Categories of Personal Information Collected
ra3,"How does Near collect or receive User data?
Through Partners
Partner SDKs used in publisher apps. Near receives MAIDs, other User data from its partners that utilize their SDKs in various publisher apps.
API Connectors. Near’s APIs are connected to various partners APIs. Such partners share MAIDs, IP, location and other User data through these APIs.

Ad Network Providers. We receive MAIDs and other information about Users from the mobile ad network providers for targeted advertising purpose. For advertising targeted to Users in the EU, UK, and Switzerland, Near is an approved status vendor and participates in the IAB Europe Transparency and Consent Framework (see more at https://advertisingconsent.eu/about/). Legally sufficient consent is obtained using this framework from those publishers whose Apps utilize the framework. In addition, Users have the ability to withdraw consent at any time by contacting the publisher of the relevant App or Site and checking your privacy settings on your devices and with the Apps and Sites you visit from time to time.

Website Publisher Partner. Near receives device information and impressions from its website publisher partner for providing data intelligence services. Our Services may use persistent cookie-like tools such as javascript tag that enable us to measure the effectiveness of the ads served, and for data intelligence about the activities of Users on websites. Users are free to set their consents on the settings of their browser, operating system and device to de-activate the ability to identify their device persistently. Please refer to these settings for more information on how to disable the browser or operating system from receiving cookies and controlling your preferences, including to disallow sharing of device level information or to disable geolocation access.",Categories of Personal Information Collected
ra3,"How does Near use User information?

Our data intelligence services involve best estimate data information and reporting to customers. We use our proprietary tools to transform MAIDs collected, along with approximate geolocation information and other User data, into actionable insights for our customers. Our technology enables us to provide our customers with trend and statistical analyses, such as identifying patterns that will enhance the relevance of ads, providing advertisements to certain types of audiences, identifying and optimizing trade areas and business locations, and for helping our customers make informed business decisions about consumer behavior with trend and movement information. We provide actionable insights, patterns and commonalities to enable our customers understand trends, and evaluate the products and services they offer, such as enabling engagement with audience and enhancing customer experience for an ecommerce website or app.

The MAIDs we collect are stored in our systems for advertising purposes only. Much of the other information collected is further anonymized into aggregated files and use of data points without unique identifiers or only with a hashed identifier. The geolocation we collect is also randomly jittered as another step in making the data less personal. We sell cluster of information which includes hashed device identifiers with jittered geolocation information to customers that utilize our data intelligence services. This information is used in a number of ways to offer such customers, information about business trends, reports, patterns.
A part of the technology retains MAIDs to cater to our US specific customer’s request for targeted advertising, measurement and matching. This data is stored separately from the anonymized data.

Near provides audience curation for advertising, understanding trends etc., but does not create data segments that are based on sensitive personal information (for example, religion or credit worthiness). However, We may create health-related segments such as an inferred interest in diet and wellness, but not sensitive health data such as medical conditions or diseases. All of our customers who subscribe to our Services are required to conform to the applicable privacy laws and regulations as well as our contractual requirements. Near prohibits the use of its Services by others for (a) employment, credit or health care eligibility; (b) insurance eligibility, underwriting, or pricing; (c) unlawful tracking or surveillance of individuals or for generating personally identifiable information.

Our Services also include advertising services that allow us to help our advertising and publishing customers provide more relevant advertising and content on the Apps on our Network. In general, we use the User information collected from partners to enhance our advertising services by providing ad content that is more closely related to Users interests. For example, the information is used to create audiences that are grouped together based on shared preferences (e.g., Sports Fans, car enthusiasts, movie goers, travellers) and to measure the effectiveness of ad campaigns. Data used to create online audiences is de-identified, helping ensure that neither the ad server nor our cookies contain personal data. We may assign a Near ID in our internal systems for your browser, computer or mobile device when we serve an ad to it or we identify it on a publisher partner’s website or mobile app. The Near ID and other information collected via the Services can also help our advertising customers measure the effectiveness of advertisements delivered via the Services. They enable the Services to determine within a reasonable level of confidence that a computer or device is the same as one with which the Services has previously interacted. For instance, the Services can determine that a computer or device to which we served an ad on Monday may be the same computer or device for which we observed a purchase on Tuesday. In other words, in such cases we are able to infer that a device (e.g. your computer) and another device (e.g. your smartphone) are used by the same owner. Where we are able to make such inferences, we may use this information to deliver targeted ads across multiple computers or devices. This is sometimes referred to as cross-device advertising.",Others

ra3,"Who do we share User Information with and purpose for sharing this information?
Near shares derived intelligence over data collected with customers, partners third-party service providers, affiliates of Group Companies, prospective acquirer, for the following purposes:
Customers and partners

When customers need MAIDs for targeted advertising, measurements and matching, we sell unhashed MAIDs only for this purpose. We ensure our customers do not use MAIDs for any other purpose except for the purposes mentioned immediately above. All other information is sold in an aggregate and anonymized manner which cannot identify you. It is essentially to provide segments, trends, patterns, reports and insights to the customers.
Third-party service Providers

With those entities that help us make the Services available and functional, like technical agents, payment processing vendors, other subcontractors, and our affiliates and consultants under contract and with safeguards. These functions include, for example, web site hosting, maintenance, data analysis, customer support, email delivery services, infrastructure services, technical agents, analytics and metrics services. These third parties will be restricted in the way they can use PI and will need to keep your information confidential and secure.
Affiliates of Group Companies
Near will share your information within the Near group of companies to ensure Near is able to provide Services to its customers.
Government, Law Enforcement Agencies or Regulatory Bodies

Near will share your information with applicable government, legal agencies or regulatory bodies in order to comply with applicable laws and investigations or to respond to a court order, judicial or other government subpoena.
Acquiror or Merger Entity
Near may transfer information, including any personal data, to a successor entity in connection with a corporate merger, consolidation, sale of assets, bankruptcy, or other corporate change.
Other

Near may share your personal data with your consent or if it believes that it will protect Near, you or any other person or third party or to enforce any legal rights.",Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

ra3,"Dispute Resolution

This Privacy Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Singapore applicable to agreements made and performed in Singapore, excluding the application of the conflict of law provisions. You agree that any action or suit brought by a party to enforce or adjudicate your rights under this Agreement shall be brought in the courts located in Singapore. This Privacy Policy is subject to our Terms of Service.",Updated Privacy Policy
ra3,Effective: 18 July 2022,Updated Privacy Policy

ra3,"We collect the following types of information from our Users:

Information You Provide: When you set up your account, provide us with an email, or share information with us in any other way, such as a customer support request, we collect and store the information you share. This will include your Twitter handle, but not your password which is retained by Twitter. You do not have to share information with us, but without it you may not be able to access certain content or features of the Products.
Automatic Collection: Like many technology providers, we use common internet technologies such as cookies on Sites and persistent tools on Apps to keep track of users’ interactions with the Products. These tools will collect general device and browser information, including device type and model, browser type and version, app type and versions, as well as information related to your use of the Products. We also contract with third party providers who use similar tracking tags on the Products via SDKs, to collect information about your use of the Products, for advertising, analytics, and measurement purposes. More about this is discussed below.
Publicly Posted: If you post information on public areas via the Products (or elsewhere on the internet), that information is public and may be collected, stored and used by anyone, including us. We use a Twitter API to pull up your posts and timeline information; such information is stored by Twitter and is not stored by us.
Use of Social Media Applications: The Products utilize certain API “feeds” or other mechanisms provided by third parties, notably Twitter (“Third Party Apps”), to access your accounts as authorized by you when you use of the Products. Those Third Party Apps may share information about you with us, depending upon the privacy settings you have set within your account for such Third Party Apps. The Third Party App settings enabled by you do not allow us to access content, data or information not authorized by those privacy settings. Please refer to the privacy settings in your Third Party Apps account to manage your public profile and other aspects of your account with those Third Party Apps.
Mobile Location Information: If you consent to allow access to your geo location on the Products, and the Products are location enabled, we will collect and store information related to your mobile device location including over time to help provide a better experience with our Products and in connection with advertising, analytics, and measurement. Some functional use of the Products may be dependent on the data related to geolocation information (such as when you post a tweet from or about a location). If the settings on your device allow us to receive location information, we may also associate location information with other information we have about you. You are always free to turn off geolocation on your device (or limit it to certain Apps).",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra3,"Some of this information may identify a particular device and may be “personal information” under some jurisdictions. Personal Information, as the term used in the United States, or Personal Data as referred to pursuant to the European Directives 95/46/EC and 2002/58/EC (EU General Data Protection Regulations Legislation, also known as “GDPR”) (hereinafter “PI”) has different definitions. Different regulations around the world may use different terminology and apply a different description of what information is considered personal information, so we encourage you to visit our jurisdictional specific pages as applicable (i.e. GDPR Notice).

The information we collect from devices that may be considered PI are:

your Twitter handle
mobile advertising device IDs (MAIDs): these are IDFAs for iOS, and Android Ad IDs for Android
Information about a User’s activities or actions on the Products and interaction with advertising that run on the Products (session start/stop time, and advertising click-stream information)
IP addresses and general location data that can be extrapolated from an IP address level (city or postal code)
Latitude and longitude geolocation information if a User has provided consent from the relevant Product and enabled the mobile device to share location information. You are always free to turn off geolocation (or limit it to certain mobile applications) or to adjust your advertising settings on your device.
For clarity, and without limiting the above, we do not collect information that directly identifies a natural person, including the following information, among other information: names, email addresses, cell phone or home phone numbers, login passwords, social security, drivers licenses. We also do not collect financial or other sensitive information.",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra3,"HOW INFORMATION WE COLLECT IS USED
We use the information we collect for a variety of business purposes in connection with the Products, which include the following purposes:

Providing Our Services: Generally we use the information we collect about Users to inform about our products (including advertising) as described in this Policy and to fulfill your requests and validate your User rights; contact and communicate with you; and as otherwise described in this Policy.
Serving Ads: To allow us to offer advertising inventory in the Products and to fill that inventory with relevant ads.
Performance Analytics: To analyze ad performance, such as tracking views of ads, as well as click-through rates to websites or app stores and/or installs of apps that have been advertised.
Service Usage and Support: To calculate usage levels, to help diagnose server problems, and administer the Products.
Use for Our Services Business (as described in our Business Services Privacy Policy)
As we believe to be necessary or appropriate: (a) under applicable law, including laws outside a User’s country of residence; (b) to comply with subpoenas, warrants, or other legal process; (c) to respond to requests from public and government authorities including public and government authorities outside an User’s country of residence; (d) to enforce our terms and conditions; (e) to protect our operations; (f) to protect our rights, privacy, safety or property, and/or that of our affiliates, Users, or others; and (g) to allow us to pursue available remedies or limit the damages that we may sustain.",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra3,"PI May Be Shared As Follows:
during due diligence or in preparation for or after a sale, merger, consolidation, change in control, transfer of substantial assets, reorganization or liquidation. If Near or its assets is purchased, all associated data and information will be transferred.
with those entities who are helping us make the Services available and functional under contract and with safeguards. These include third-party vendors, technical agents, subcontractors, and our affiliates and consultants who assist us in performing functions to operate our Services. These functions include, for example, website hosting, maintenance, data analysis, customer support, infrastructure services, technical agents, analytics and metrics services. These third parties will be contractually restricted in the way they can use PI.
As in any transaction, if you provide your credit card information for purchases on Product, our credit card processor and your credit card company will be provided with all relevant information about us, item(s) purchased, cost and other information necessary to process the transaction. We use a third party service provider to process payments made on our Sites, so your credit card information is not collected and retained by us.
when permitted or required by law or where we believe such action is necessary in order to protect or defend our interests or the interests of our users or business partners.
We may disclose PI to the extent required by law, or if we have a good-faith belief that we need to disclose it in order to comply with official investigations or legal proceedings (whether initiated by governmental/law enforcement officials, or private parties). If we have to disclose PI to governmental/law enforcement officials, we may not be able to ensure that those officials will maintain the privacy and security of PI.",Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

ra3,"CHANGES TO PRIVACY POLICY\nNear reserves the right to change this Privacy Policy at any time, and will do so by posting changes to this Privacy Policy. The new Privacy Policy will apply to all Users of the Products and will replace any prior Privacy Policies that are inconsistent.",Updated Privacy Policy

ra3,"Under the CCPA, Personal Information is defined to include all of the following categories:

Category	Examples
Identifiers.	A unique personal identifier, Internet Protocol address, email address, account name, or other similar identifiers.
Personal information categories listed in the California Customer Records statute (Cal. Civ. Code § 1798.80(e)).	Social Security number, passport number, driver’s license or state identification card number, insurance policy number, education, employment, employment history, bank account number, credit card number, debit card number, or any other financial information, medical information, or health insurance information.
Protected classification characteristics under California or federal law.	Age (40 years or older), race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship, religion or creed, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, gender, pregnancy or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, genetic information (including familial genetic information).
Biometric information.	Genetic, physiological, behavioral, and biological characteristics, or activity patterns used to extract a template or other identifier or identifying information, such as, fingerprints, faceprints, and voiceprints, iris or retina scans, keystroke, gait, or other physical patterns, and sleep, health, or exercise data.
Browsing history	Internet activity information including browsing history, search history, interaction with a website or with advertisements.
Geolocation data.	Physical location or movements.
Sensory data.	Audio, electronic, visual, thermal, olfactory, or similar information.",Categories of Personal Information Collected

column1:
ra3,"Use of Personal Information
As discussed more fully in our Privacy Policies, most of the information we collect and use is de-identified and aggregated information, such as de-identified categories of app use and jittered geolocation information associated with a de-identified device id. We also provide partners with de-identified device id information, except in the case when the actual device id is needed, such as for targeted advertising and for matching and measurement of advertising. De-identified and aggregated information is not Personal Information, and we use such information in a number of ways for our business intelligence services as we discuss in our Privacy Policy, including for marketing and targeted advertising and data analytics.

We do not use your twitter handle other than to authenticate your use on our Twitter-based Apps.",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra3,"Use of Personal Information
As discussed more fully in our Privacy Policies, most of the information we collect and use is de-identified and aggregated information, such as de-identified categories of app use and jittered geolocation information associated with a de-identified device id. We also provide partners with de-identified device id information, except in the case when the actual device id is needed, such as for targeted advertising and for matching and measurement of advertising. De-identified and aggregated information is not Personal Information, and we use such information in a number of ways for our business intelligence services as we discuss in our Privacy Policy, including for marketing and targeted advertising and data analytics.

We do not use your twitter handle other than to authenticate your use on our Twitter-based Apps.",Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

We do not use your twitter handle other than to authenticate your use on our Twitter-based Apps.",Categories of Personal Information Sold

ra3,"Information Request
You have the right to request that we disclose certain information about our collection and use of your Personal Information about you over the past 12 months. To provide this information we need your mobile advertising device id (which is a unique id number assigned to each device). We ask you to complete a form and then follow the instructions to provide us with a legible image of your mobile advertising device id. Once we receive and confirm your consumer request, we will disclose to you:

The categories of Personal Information we collected about you.
The categories of sources for the Personal Information we collected about you.
Our business or commercial purpose for collecting or selling that Personal Information.
The categories of third parties with whom we share that Personal Information.
If we sold or disclosed your Personal Information for a business purpose, we will also identify the categories of Personal Information we shared by such sale.",Description of Right to Know PI Collected

ra3,"Information Request
You have the right to request that we disclose certain information about our collection and use of your Personal Information about you over the past 12 months. To provide this information we need your mobile advertising device id (which is a unique id number assigned to each device). We ask you to complete a form and then follow the instructions to provide us with a legible image of your mobile advertising device id. Once we receive and confirm your consumer request, we will disclose to you:

The categories of Personal Information we collected about you.
The categories of sources for the Personal Information we collected about you.
Our business or commercial purpose for collecting or selling that Personal Information.
The categories of third parties with whom we share that Personal Information.
If we sold or disclosed your Personal Information for a business purpose, we will also identify the categories of Personal Information we shared by such sale.",Description of Right to Know PI sold / shared
ra3,You have the right to request that we opt out your Personal Information from any sales.,Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI
ra3,You also have the right to request that we delete your Personal Information. ,Description of Right to Delete

ra3,We may deny your deletion request if we cannot verify the device id or it meets one of the exemptions under CCPA. We will also retain a copy of our records related to processing your request.,Description of Right to Delete
ra3,"To exercise the rights described above, please visit our Consumer Choices pages.",Methods to exercise rights
ra3,Non-Discrimination\nWe will not discriminate against you for exercising any of your CCPA rights.,Description of Right to Non-discrimination on exercising rights

ra3,"Changes to This Notice\nWe reserve the right to amend this notice at our discretion and at any time. When we make changes to this privacy notice, we will post the update information on our website.",Updated Privacy Policy

ra3,"he categories of personal information collected by Near’s business services are mobile advertising device ids (MAID), IP addresses, advertising click stream information and location data associated with that device as discussed more fully in our Business Services Privacy Policy. Among other things, we do not collect an actual cell phone numbers or your name, full address or email address.

A sample of what personal information for a device is as follows:

Mobile advertising device id
IP Addresses and general (city or postal code) location data that can be extrapolated from an IP address
Latitude and longitude points
Timestamps with local dates and times and time zones",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra3,"DO NOT SELL MY PERSONAL INFORMATION\nCCPA ensures that Users are provided with the right to opt-out from their personal data being sold. If you would like to opt out of all sales of any personal information we may have associated with your device, please click here to complete a form to OPT OUT OF SALES. The information you supply to us for this request will only be used for the purpose of identifying the personal information about the device which you are requesting and responding to your request (including a record of our efforts).",Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

ra3,"If you would like to opt out of all sales of any personal information we may have associated with your device, please click here to complete a form to OPT OUT OF SALES.",Methods to exercise rights

ra3,"DELETION REQUEST\nIf you would like us to DELETE the personal information we have associated with your device, please click here to complete a form to request DATA DELETION. The information you supply to us for this request will only be used for the purpose of identifying the Personal Information about the device which you are requesting and responding to your request (including a record of our efforts).",Description of Right to Delete
ra3,"If you would like us to DELETE the personal information we have associated with your device, please click here to complete a form to request DATA DELETION. ",Methods to exercise rights
ra3,Certain jurisdictions also provide consumers with rights to request access (correction or portability) of the personal information held about them. ,Description of Right to Correct Information

ra3,"We do not accept and will terminate a client if we learn of any dishonest or illegal practices on their part.
We do not allow use of our data by law enforcement.
We do not allow use of our data to target advertising to people below the legal age (for example, alcohol and casinos) or to create audiences for locations primarily visited by children (such as preschools, playgrounds).
We do not allow use of our data for employment, credit, health care, or insurance purposes.
We do not allow use of our data to target vulnerable or sensitive communities (for example, by political, religious, sexual orientation or medical affiliation), or to identify those within sensitive areas (e.g.conflict zones, hospitals, protests, religious sites, clinics, etc) or to places.",Others

ra2,"Marketing cookies are used to track visitors across websites. The intention is to display ads that are relevant and engaging for the individual user and thereby more valuable for publishers and third party advertisers.

collect	LinkedIn	Collects data on user behaviour and interaction in order to optimize the website and make advertisement on the website more relevant.	Session	Pixel

test_cookie	Google	Used to check if the user's browser supports cookies.	1 day	HTTP
pagead/1p-user-list/#	Google	Tracks if the user has shown interest in specific products or events across multiple websites and detects how the user navigates between sites. This is used for measurement of advertisement efforts and facilitates payment of referral-fees between websites.	Session	Pixel
__ptq.gif	Hubspot	Sends data to the marketing platform Hubspot about the visitor's device and behaviour. Tracks the visitor across devices and marketing channels.	Session	Pixel
bcookie	LinkedIn	Used by the social networking service, LinkedIn, for tracking the use of embedded services.	1 year	HTTP
bscookie	LinkedIn	Used by the social networking service, LinkedIn, for tracking the use of embedded services.	1 year	HTTP

_rm_dr	assets.rampmetrics.com	Pending	1 day	HTTP

ra2," Google Analytics employs cookies that are stored on your computer in order to facilitate an analysis of your use of the Website. The information generated by these cookies, such as time, place and frequency of your visits to our Website, including your IP address, is transmitted to Google’s location in the US and stored there.",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra2,"(A) Sharing with Near’s Group Companies
Near will share your personal information within the Near group of companies for the purpose identified above.

If you are using an email address that is associated with a business domain (e.g., yourname@businessname.com) to access the Site, we may provide your personal information to that business.

(B) Sharing with Service Providers
Near will share your personal information with companies that help us run our business by processing personal information on behalf of Near for the purposes identified above. Such companies include Amazon Web Services and Google Analytics.

(C) Sharing with Government, Law Enforcement Agencies or Regulatory Bodies
Near will share your personal information with applicable government, legal agencies or regulatory bodies in order to comply with applicable laws and investigations or to respond to a court order, judicial or other government subpoena.

(D) Sharing with Acquiror or Merger Entity
Near may transfer information, including any personal information, to a successor entity in connection with a corporate merger, consolidation, sale of assets, bankruptcy, or other corporate change. If Near is involved in a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or a portion of its assets, you will be notified via email and/or a prominent notice on our Site of any change in ownership or uses of your personal information, as well as any choices you may have regarding your personal information.

(E) Other Information Sharing
Near may share your personal information with your consent or if it believes that it will protect Near, you or any other person or third party or to enforce any legal rights.",Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

ra2,"(D) Sharing with Acquiror or Merger Entity\nNear may transfer information, including any personal information, to a successor entity in connection with a corporate merger, consolidation, sale of assets, bankruptcy, or other corporate change. ra2,"We collect the following types of information from our Users:

Information You Provide: When you set up your account, provide us with an email, or share information with us in any other way, such as a customer support request, we collect and store the information you share. This will include your Twitter handle, but not your password which is retained by Twitter. You do not have to share information with us, but without it you may not be able to access certain content or features of the Products.
Automatic Collection: Like many technology providers, we use common internet technologies such as cookies on Sites and persistent tools on Apps to keep track of users’ interactions with the Products. These tools will collect general device and browser information, including device type and model, browser type and version, app type and versions, as well as information related to your use of the Products. We also contract with third party providers who use similar tracking tags on the Products via SDKs, to collect information about your use of the Products, for advertising, analytics, and measurement purposes. More about this is discussed below.
Publicly Posted: If you post information on public areas via the Products (or elsewhere on the internet), that information is public and may be collected, stored and used by anyone, including us. We use a Twitter API to pull up your posts and timeline information; such information is stored by Twitter and is not stored by us.
Use of Social Media Applications: The Products utilize certain API “feeds” or other mechanisms provided by third parties, notably Twitter (“Third Party Apps”), to access your accounts as authorized by you when you use of the Products. Those Third Party Apps may share information about you with us, depending upon the privacy settings you have set within your account for such Third Party Apps. The Third Party App settings enabled by you do not allow us to access content, data or information not authorized by those privacy settings. Please refer to the privacy settings in your Third Party Apps account to manage your public profile and other aspects of your account with those Third Party Apps.
Mobile Location Information: If you consent to allow access to your geo location on the Products, and the Products are location enabled, we will collect and store information related to your mobile device location including over time to help provide a better experience with our Products and in connection with advertising, analytics, and measurement. Some functional use of the Products may be dependent on the data related to geolocation information (such as when you post a tweet from or about a location). If the settings on your device allow us to receive location information, we may also associate location information with other information we have about you. You are always free to turn off geolocation on your device (or limit it to certain Apps).",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra2,"The information we collect from devices that may be considered PI are:

your Twitter handle
mobile advertising device IDs (MAIDs): these are IDFAs for iOS, and Android Ad IDs for Android
Information about a User’s activities or actions on the Products and interaction with advertising that run on the Products (session start/stop time, and advertising click-stream information)
IP addresses and general location data that can be extrapolated from an IP address level (city or postal code)
Latitude and longitude geolocation information if a User has provided consent from the relevant Product and enabled the mobile device to share location information. You are always free to turn off geolocation (or limit it to certain mobile applications) or to adjust your advertising settings on your device.",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra2,"We use the information we collect for a variety of business purposes in connection with the Products, which include the following purposes:

Providing Our Services: Generally we use the information we collect about Users to inform about our products (including advertising) as described in this Policy and to fulfill your requests and validate your User rights; contact and communicate with you; and as otherwise described in this Policy.
Serving Ads: To allow us to offer advertising inventory in the Products and to fill that inventory with relevant ads.
Performance Analytics: To analyze ad performance, such as tracking views of ads, as well as click-through rates to websites or app stores and/or installs of apps that have been advertised.
Service Usage and Support: To calculate usage levels, to help diagnose server problems, and administer the Products.
Use for Our Services Business (as described in our Business Services Privacy Policy)
As we believe to be necessary or appropriate: (a) under applicable law, including laws outside a User’s country of residence; (b) to comply with subpoenas, warrants, or other legal process; (c) to respond to requests from public and government authorities including public and government authorities outside an User’s country of residence; (d) to enforce our terms and conditions; (e) to protect our operations; (f) to protect our rights, privacy, safety or property, and/or that of our affiliates, Users, or others; and (g) to allow us to pursue available remedies or limit the damages that we may sustain.",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra2,"Anonymous/Aggregated Information. Anonymous or aggregated information that does not identify you personally, like usage and metrics information, may be shared with others, including partners, developers, potential investors, marketers, and business partners. Anonymous information helps us understand trends and user needs so that we can better design new products and services and refine existing products and services to serve our customers better.",Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

ra2,"PI May Be Shared As Follows:
during due diligence or in preparation for or after a sale, merger, consolidation, change in control, transfer of substantial assets, reorganization or liquidation. If Near or its assets is purchased, all associated data and information will be transferred.
with those entities who are helping us make the Services available and functional under contract and with safeguards. These include third-party vendors, technical agents, subcontractors, and our affiliates and consultants who assist us in performing functions to operate our Services. These functions include, for example, website hosting, maintenance, data analysis, customer support, infrastructure services, technical agents, analytics and metrics services. These third parties will be contractually restricted in the way they can use PI.
As in any transaction, if you provide your credit card information for purchases on Product, our credit card processor and your credit card company will be provided with all relevant information about us, item(s) purchased, cost and other information necessary to process the transaction. We use a third party service provider to process payments made on our Sites, so your credit card information is not collected and retained by us.
when permitted or required by law or where we believe such action is necessary in order to protect or defend our interests or the interests of our users or business partners.
We may disclose PI to the extent required by law, or if we have a good-faith belief that we need to disclose it in order to comply with official investigations or legal proceedings (whether initiated by governmental/law enforcement officials, or private parties). If we have to disclose PI to governmental/law enforcement officials, we may not be able to ensure that those officials will maintain the privacy and security of PI.",Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

ra2,"Under the CCPA, Personal Information is defined to include all of the following categories:

Category	Examples
Identifiers.	A unique personal identifier, Internet Protocol address, email address, account name, or other similar identifiers.
Personal information categories listed in the California Customer Records statute (Cal. Civ. Code § 1798.80(e)).	Social Security number, passport number, driver’s license or state identification card number, insurance policy number, education, employment, employment history, bank account number, credit card number, debit card number, or any other financial information, medical information, or health insurance information.
Protected classification characteristics under California or federal law.	Age (40 years or older), race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship, religion or creed, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, gender, pregnancy or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, genetic information (including familial genetic information).
Biometric information.	Genetic, physiological, behavioral, and biological characteristics, or activity patterns used to extract a template or other identifier or identifying information, such as, fingerprints, faceprints, and voiceprints, iris or retina scans, keystroke, gait, or other physical patterns, and sleep, health, or exercise data.
Browsing history	Internet activity information including browsing history, search history, interaction with a website or with advertisements.
Geolocation data.	Physical location or movements.
Sensory data.	Audio, electronic, visual, thermal, olfactory, or similar information.",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra2,"You have the right to request that we disclose certain information about our collection and use of your Personal Information about you over the past 12 months. To provide this information we need your mobile advertising device id (which is a unique id number assigned to each device). We ask you to complete a form and then follow the instructions to provide us with a legible image of your mobile advertising device id. Once we receive and confirm your consumer request, we will disclose to you:

The categories of Personal Information we collected about you.
The categories of sources for the Personal Information we collected about you.
Our business or commercial purpose for collecting or selling that Personal Information.
The categories of third parties with whom we share that Personal Information.
If we sold or disclosed your Personal Information for a business purpose, we will also identify the categories of Personal Information we shared by such sale.",Description of Right to Know PI Collected

ra2,CCPA provides consumers with rights to request access of the Personal Information about them when the consumer can verify that they are the rightful owner of the information requested. ,Description of Right to Know PI Collected

ra2,"You have the right to request that we opt out your Personal Information from any sales. You also have the right to request that we delete your Personal Information. Once we receive and confirm your verifiable consumer request, we will honor your request (and direct our service providers to as well).",Description of Right to Opt-out of sale of PI

ra2,"You have the right to request that we opt out your Personal Information from any sales. You also have the right to request that we delete your Personal Information. Once we receive and confirm your verifiable consumer request, we will honor your request (and direct our service providers to as well).\n\nWe may deny your deletion request if we cannot verify the device id or it meets one of the exemptions under CCPA. We will also retain a copy of our records related to processing your request.",Description of Right to Delete
ra2,Non-Discrimination\nWe will not discriminate against you for exercising any of your CCPA rights.,Description of Right to Non-discrimination on exercising rights

ra5,"Usage Information\nOur Site uses Google Analytics, a web analysis service of Google, Inc. Google Analytics employs cookies that are stored on your computer in order to facilitate an analysis of your use of the Website. The information generated by these cookies, such as time, place and frequency of your visits to our Website, including your IP address, is transmitted to Google’s location in the US and stored there.",Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

ra5,"Use of information collected by Near and the legal basis for these uses
(A) Purpose
Near uses the information for the following purposes:

Responding to your inquiry;
Sending you information about Near products and services;
Sending you marketing emails; and
Investigating and responding to any comments or complaints that you may send us.
(B) Consent
Where required, when you give Near your consent, we place cookies and use similar technologies on our Site, and in email communications, in accordance with our Cookie Policy.

4. Cookies
A cookie is a text file containing an identification number which, when the Site is used, is transmitted to the user’s computer together with the other data actually requested and stored there. The file is kept there for later access and serves to authenticate the user.",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra5,"Sharing of personal information
(A) Sharing with Near’s Group Companies
Near will share your personal information within the Near group of companies for the purpose identified above.

If you are using an email address that is associated with a business domain (e.g., yourname@businessname.com) to access the Site, we may provide your personal information to that business.",Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

ra5,"(B) Sharing with Service Providers
Near will share your personal information with companies that help us run our business by processing personal information on behalf of Near for the purposes identified above. Such companies include Amazon Web Services and Google Analytics.

(C) Sharing with Government, Law Enforcement Agencies or Regulatory Bodies
Near will share your personal information with applicable government, legal agencies or regulatory bodies in order to comply with applicable laws and investigations or to respond to a court order, judicial or other government subpoena.

(D) Sharing with Acquiror or Merger Entity
Near may transfer information, including any personal information, to a successor entity in connection with a corporate merger, consolidation, sale of assets, bankruptcy, or other corporate change. If Near is involved in a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or a portion of its assets, you will be notified via email and/or a prominent notice on our Site of any change in ownership or uses of your personal information, as well as any choices you may have regarding your personal information.

(E) Other Information Sharing
Near may share your personal information with your consent or if it believes that it will protect Near, you or any other person or third party or to enforce any legal rights.",Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

ra5,"How does Near collect or receive User data?
Through Partners

Partner SDKs used in publisher apps. Near receives MAIDs, other User data from its partners that utilize their SDKs in various publisher apps.
API Connectors. Near’s APIs are connected to various partners APIs. Such partners share MAIDs, IP, location and other User data through these APIs.
Ad Network Providers. We receive MAIDs and other information about Users from the mobile ad network providers for targeted advertising purpose",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra5,"Website Publisher Partner. Near receives device information and impressions from its website publisher partner for providing data intelligence services. Our Services may use persistent cookie-like tools such as javascript tag that enable us to measure the effectiveness of the ads served, and for data intelligence about the activities of Users on websites. ",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra5,"API Connectors. Near’s APIs are connected to various partners APIs. Such partners share MAIDs, IP, location and other User data through these APIs.",Categories of Personal Information Shared / Disclosed

ra5,"How does Near use User information?\nOur data intelligence services involve best estimate data information and reporting to customers. We use our proprietary tools to transform MAIDs collected, along with approximate geolocation information and other User data, into actionable insights for our customers. Our technology enables us to provide our customers with trend and statistical analyses, such as identifying patterns that will enhance the relevance of ads, providing advertisements to certain types of audiences, identifying and optimizing trade areas and business locations, and for helping our customers make informed business decisions about consumer behavior with trend and movement information. We provide actionable insights, patterns and commonalities to enable our customers understand trends, and evaluate the products and services they offer, such as enabling engagement with audience and enhancing customer experience for an ecommerce website or app.",Categories of Personal Information Collected

ra5,"We sell cluster of information which includes hashed device identifiers with jittered geolocation information to customers that utilize our data intelligence services. This information is used in a number of ways to offer such customers, information about business trends, reports, patterns.",Categories of Personal Information Sold
